lexUnit.name: pacify.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: quell the anger or agitation of.

sentence.text: Nobody was prepared to have any dealings with this force , even to attempt to pacify it by being kind to the black cat .
The good ` Rev. " attempted to pacify them by pointing out that the evening was a glorious opportunity to meet the players in an informal atmosphere , and to buy their heroes a drink .
Nor , despite a close friendship with the evangelist D. L. Hoody , could he pacify the more conservative evangelicals in his audience .
Maggie wanted to please and pacify him on this her holiday at any cost .
While one crew got through , Jugoslavs Rodic/Kvezenic decided to retreat back to the jetty , leaving marshal John Griffiths to pacify an irate violence-threatening angler .
Some critics question its sustainability and others view it as a sop to pacify the poor .
` I did n't say that , " he murmured , but he was no longer smiling or trying to pacify her .
Only the promise of another potential platinum record had finally pacified him .
This might have something to do with pacifying the masses , since the 15,000 foreign delegates had unprecedented freedom to mingle with ordinary North Koreans , normally isolated from foreigners .
It is usually said that the introduction of NEP pacified the peasants , but the Famine had a quicker effect in this respect .

He was scathing about the notion that Indians might be pacified by political concession , observing of the Montagu-Chelmsford reforms that : ` If the Indians are capable of providing the directorate , they must surely be capable of providing the agents " .

The client who was not convinced and pacified by what his dealer said would not only refuse to trade further with him , but would not sleep easy at night , tormented by the thoughts of his investments tossing up and down like a rowing boat in a stormy sea .

When in 1857 something new began to grow in Nova Scotia Gardens , financed by Angela Burdett-Coutts at the prompting of Dickens , the residents protested so vehemently that they had to be pacified by the architect and restrained by the law .
As I see it , she is , in a sense , full , and so her own emptiness can be ignored or pacified .
To take a specific and vivid example , it is very common for mothers ( and fathers ) to feel a violent impulse towards babies who can not be pacified .
The Caucasus had been steadily pacified and nominal Russian authority made effective .
Ludens , aware but gazing ahead , felt a deep weary compassionate feeling of tenderness and pity which soothed and pacified the anguish of his exaltation and his fear .
Richard Baxter again pacified the crowd and eventually finished his sermon without further interruption .
But he had skilfully pacified even the most vociferous of dissenters .
Sainz had to pacify angry paying spectators when the Kershope leg was cancelled after a medical emergency in the crowd had delayed the timing and left drivers without spotlights .
` Uh huh , " said I. I was not easily pacified but the show had already been aired . "
